I hovered over her, lying in bed, too weak to move or even talk properly. “Son,” she whispered.

“Hi... Mom,” I said, turning the pages of the old diary, “Missing something?”

“Please... Give it back,” she begged.

“Couldn't you have died silently?” I was angry, “Whoever gave you the permission to publish my darkest secrets?”

“But... You... Killed him...”

“He fell down,” I hummed, “And broke his crown.”

“You pushed him,” she cried.

“Shh... That doesn't rhyme.” I smashed her head with the hardbound book.
                             “Does it?” I kept smashing.
